lumber.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to move in a slow awkward way
lumber.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to give someone a job or responsibility that they do not want
lumber.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: A career was less easy once I was lumbered with a husband and children.
lumber.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to cut down trees in a large area and prepare them to be sold
lumber.translation[1].definitions[0].def: pieces of wood used for building, that have been cut to specific lengths and widths
lumber.translation[1].definitions[1].def: large objects that are no longer useful or wanted
lumber.translation[2].definitions[0].def: wood that has been prepared for sale
lumber.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The company operates 50 lumber and building material retail stores.
